page.title: 03The Shropshire Way
page.content: Six years ago, Wem Walkers decided to link several small public footpaths into one long one,to run the length of the county from Whitchurch to Ludlow.So they wrote to all the rambling clubs in Shropshire.They had a meeting and decided where it would go.Besides the main part, they added a loop from Ludlow to Telford and back to Wem. In all, the path is about 200 miles long.Then they divided the route into blocks, so that all the groups could work out a bit of the path.The Wem Walkers did the part from Whixall to Hadnall,and it goes right through the middle of Wem.They made and printed a guide of thirty pages.A buzzard with outstretched wings is the waymark of the Shropshire Way.If you follow the buzzard and the yellow arrows you will know that you are on the right track.
